English: 'ought to, should'; to owe; to be obligated to
to lie (e.g., on the groun), lie dead
to pray, beg, beg for (often with 2 accusatives, one of the person, the other of the thing)
to be without, free from; need, miss
to teach (ofen with 2 accusatives, one of the person, the other of the thing taught)
to be well, healthy; to be strong
